You are here:

SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE
Transform API Return Data on the Salesforce Platform

Improve performance when a B2B Commerce for Visualforce API query returns data that storefront pages show to buyers. Instead of using managed package code to transform field names for displaying data from B2B Commerce for Visualforce custom object records, you can invoke Salesforce Platform code for transforming field maps. This option is recommended for better performance with new extensions or customizations.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS

Salesforce Compatibility

Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.




B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13) only



USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To access CC Admin and change settings:	Access B2B Commerce for Visualforce Admin Settings permission set

For example, when returning data for the ccrz__CartType__c field on a ccrz__E_Cart__c record, the API removes the ccrz__ namespace prefix and __c suffix. Front-end code, such as handlebars.js templates, reference a field named only cartType.

A storefront configuration setting, Transform API Return Data on the Salesforce Platform, determines whether this transformation occurs in Salesforce Platform code or in B2B Commerce for Visualforce managed package code:

NOTE This configuration is available only in B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13) or later.
When this configuration is TRUE, the ccrz.ccService.cleanSFFldNames data service provider method invokes Salesforce Platform code for map transforms. For orgs where you've installed B2B Commerce for Visualforce for the first time using Winter ’21 (version 4.13) or later, this value is TRUE by default. We recommend that new solutions use this value whenever possible to take advantage of improved performance.
When this configuration is FALSE, map transforms occur in B2B Commerce for Visualforce managed package code, which provides compatibility with B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12) or earlier. For orgs with existing B2B Commerce solutions that upgrade to B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13), this value is FALSE to avoid breaking changes with extensions or customizations.

To continue using map transforms in the managed package code, leave this configuration set to FALSE. No extra action is required.

To enable map transforms in Salesforce Platform code:

After you upgrade the managed package to Winter ’21 (version 4.13) or later, create the configuration module in CC Admin.
NOTE Most new configurations are available automatically after you upgrade the available global data. Because this configuration potentially breaks existing extensions or customizations, manually create this configuration's metadata before you can begin using it.
On the CC Admin tab in your org, select Global Settings (1).
In the Global Settings menu, select Configuration Modules (2).
Click New (3).
In the Configuration Module window, enter the following values, and then click Save:
FIELD	VALUE
Name	Salesforce Platform Integration
API Name	platform
Create metadata for the Transform API Return Data on the Salesforce Platform configuration.
In the list of configuration modules, select the Salesforce Platform Integration module that you created (4).
In Configuration Metadata, click New (5).
In the Configuration Metadata window, enter the following values, and then click Save:
FIELD	VALUE
Name	Transform API Return Data on the Salesforce Platform
API Name	maptransform
Description	

Help text for the configuration, which must be fewer than 255 characters. Consider:

Use Apex tools on the Salesforce Platform for transforming map field names in API return data. This configuration can boost page performance. Possible values: TRUE, FALSE. To continue using legacy transform logic in the managed package, use FALSE.


Externally Safe	False (leave disabled)
Enable the Transform API Return Data on the Salesforce Platform configuration for your storefront.
On the CC Admin tab in your org, select your storefront (6).
In the Storefront Settings menu, select Configuration Settings (7).
From the Module picklist, select Salesforce Platform Integration (8).
Click New  (9), enter the following values in the New Page Setting window, and click Create.
FIELD	VALUE
Module	Salesforce Platform Integration
Configuration	Transform API Return Data on the Salesforce Platform
Page	all
Value	TRUE
Build and activate a new configuration cache.
SEE ALSO
